contentrichtext.text: {{for|the fictional character Takashi Ryuugasaki|Cyber Team in Akihabara#Other_significant_characters}} {{Refimprove|date=May 2009}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Ryūgasaki |JapaneseName= 龍ヶ崎市 |MapImage=Ryugasaki city Ibaraki prefecture Japan.svg |Region= [[Kantō region|Kantō]] |Prefecture= [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]] |District= |Area_km2= 78.20 |PopDate= April 1, 2011 |Population= 79,269 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 35 |LatitudeMinutes= 55 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 140 |LongtitudeMinutes= 11 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Ryugasaki Ibaraki.svg |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.ryugasaki.ibaraki.jp/ City of Ryugasaki] }} [[Image:Ryugasaki.jpg|thumb|175px|right|Rice paddy near Ryugasaki First Highschool in Ryugasaki, Japan.]] {{nihongo|'''Ryūgasaki'''|龍ヶ崎市|Ryūgasaki-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. ==Overview== {{Unreferenced section|date=May 2009}}As of April 1, 2011, the city has an estimated population of 79,269, with [[household]] number being 30,470, and a [[population density]] of {{Pop density|1013.67|1|km2|sqmi}}. The total area is {{Convert|78.20|km2|mi2|abbr=on}}. Ryugasaki is sometimes considered part of the Greater Tokyo Area. Many residents commute to central Tokyo. The city is the hometown of the [[Japan Football League|JFL]] semi-pro team, [[Ryutsu Keizai University]]. The city was founded on March 20, 1954. The current mayor is Kazuo Nakayama, who was elected on December 2009. {{Fact|date=May 2011}} The city of symbol bird is [[Swan]], symbol tree is [[Pinus]], and symbol flower is [[Platycodon grandiflorus]] {{Fact|date=May 2011}} Ryugasaki is the home of [[Ryutsu Keizai University]]. The [[judo]] club at Ryutsu Keizai was founded by former World, Olympic and All-Japan champion [[Isao Okano]]. ==Industry== {{Ref improve section|date=May 2009}} Ryugasaki city has well-known crystal glass factory. The founder received a prize for his work in international exhibition in Paris of 1937. At present, these crystal glasses are used in the Imperial Palace.{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}} [[New Central Airlines]], a commuter airline, is headquartered in the city, on the grounds of [[Ryūgasaki Airfield]].<ref>"[http://global.kawada.jp/corporate/affiliates.html The Kawada Group]." Kawada Industries. Retrieved on February 21, 2010.<!--The page lists the New Central HQ as Ryugasaki--></ref><ref>"[http://web.archive.org/web/20080615161042/http://www.central-air.co.jp/irregular.html 路線外運行]." New Central Airlines. Retrieved on February 21, 2010. "お問い合わせは 〒３０１－０８０６　茨城県竜ヶ崎市半田町３１７７ 竜ヶ崎飛行場内"</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline|Ryugasaki, Ibaraki|Ryūgasaki, Ibaraki}} * [http://www.city.ryugasaki.ibaraki.jp/ Ryugasaki official website] {{ja icon}} * [http://www.kasei.co.uk/ Kasei travel photography] Website featuring many photos from Ryugasaki including a slideshow on rice planting in the city {{Ibaraki}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ryugasaki, Ibaraki}} [[Category:Cities in Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
